questions.question: Which function would you use to calculate the square root of a number?
questions.explanation: sqrt() is the standard math module function for square roots.

questions.question: What is the difference between random.random() and random.randint(1, 10)?

options.text: random() gives a float, randint() gives an integer
random() only goes up to 1, while randint() can go higher

questions.explanation: random.random() returns a decimal between 0 and 1, while randint() returns a whole number within a specified range.

questions.question: Which method is used to pick a random item from a list?
questions.explanation: random.choice() is specifically designed to select one element from a sequence like a list.

questions.question: What does 'math.ceil(7.1)' return?
questions.explanation: math.ceil() (short for ceiling) always rounds up to the nearest integer.
